content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --ENRTPT
      operator: exists
    - name: --ENTPT
      operator: not_exists
Core:
  Id: CORE-000171
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raises an error when --ENRTPT is present in dataset but --ENTPT is not
  present in dataset.
Outcome:
  Message: --ENTPT should be present when --ENRTPT is present in a dataset
  Output Variables:
    - --ENRTPT
    - --ENTPT
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Dataset
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0058
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The description or date and/or time of a time point
                  that acts as a fixed reference for characterizing the end of an
                  observation. This is the sponsor-defined reference point referred
                  to by --ENRTPT.
                Document: Model v2.0
                Section: Timing
                Item: --ENTPT
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.3'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0058
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character
                  format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --ENRTPT.
                  Examples "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
                Document: Model v1.7
                Section: 2.2.5 Timing Variables for All Classes
                Item: Table 2.2.5.1, --ENTPT
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.2'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0058
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: (--ENTPT) Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or
                  other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred
                  to by --ENRTPT. Examples "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
                Document: Model v1.4
                Section: 2.2.5 Timing Variables for All Classes
                Item: Specification
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Raises an error when --ENRTPT is present in dataset but --ENTPT is not present in dataset.

Outcome.Message: --ENTPT should be present when --ENRTPT is present in a dataset

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The description or date and/or time of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for characterizing the end of an observation. This is the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --ENRTPT.
Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --ENRTPT. Examples "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
(--ENTPT) Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --ENRTPT. Examples "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
